@dentonmatthew22 Not sure who DT is, but I didn’t know JT didn’t support sex education and instead, as a grown man in a position of extreme authority, creeped young women online & sent them dick pics. That comparison is fascinating. #sarcasmfont

@fordnation What a bloated load of fresh shit.
@emiiilyt And hey, I’m all for being smart with using the resources one has in a purposeful way. Hoping they do more for you guys too. Once a year isn’t enough to show appreciation for staff.

@emiiilyt Yes. Corporate memberships allow them to use the venue mostly for “business networking” (fun with business colleagues/lunches/drinks) on the company dime 99% of the time. To save resources on events requiring actual effort, they’ll hold staff events there other 1% of the time.

@emiiilyt They count on the fact that you guys probably don’t get out much as far as work-sponsored events go. Literally anything is better than a boardroom, which is kinda minimum. I think they can do better.

@emiiilyt It’s a staff event, no? Tell me your “leaders” put some considered and inclusive thought into what ALL of you would like to do/places to go which appealed to as many of you as possible and I’ll take back what I said :)
@emiiilyt For sure. But total bro culture move on the part of the organizer. I hate it when workplaces do that shit. #FuckGolf

@RealSarah103 @flematic All of what you said was pulled directly out your ass. Get at me with more than your armchair opinion and flagrant bias. I’ll listen to actual evidence. Sit back down.

Cohen says Trump told him ‘Black people are too stupid to vote for me’. #TheIrony https://t.co/UcufvNAgRo
@flematic He said he “gave them everything they asked for”. Why would you assume he didn’t provide the criteria they required for gambling > $10K. It’s not like that would be hard for him to do.
@JunctionJason @TrueBloodHBO And all babies were breastfeeding babies - which I noticed. And they didn’t mince sex/nudity. Which I appreciated. 😬

@JunctionJason @TrueBloodHBO I agree. I don’t know why? I know it was “different” but if people stuck with it they would see the brilliance. They also did “diversity” in a fun way. Way better than any show I have ever seen. Some great life lessons in those stories.
RT @VICE: Nelsan Ellis's portrayal of Lafayette Reynolds made me proud to be a queer black man: https://t.co/BBeaSEA09G https://t.co/aB73fs…

Watched all 7 seasons of @TrueBloodHBO. Wow. So good! The character development and tongue-in-cheek stereotype representation was some of my favourite in a fan fiction show. Lafayette is my bitch. And I’d fuck with Eric. 🙌🏼 Is mourning the end of a series a thing? ☹️ #Sookie4Eva
